title: CLient says i am offline yet my internet is fibe
body: I am unable to connect to league at all and even when i switch over to the league client i get a rads error and cant launch it either and I know i have all the permissions set to allow it any idea what is up.

replies.body:
> If you guys are experiencing a RADS error and your play button in the client is grayed out, try flushing your DNS. I just had the problem myself.
> 
> First, close out of league and open Command Prompt (Windows) by searching for "cmd" in your start menu (without quotations, obviously.)
> 
> Next, when the Command Promp appears, type "ipconfig /flushdns" (again, without the quotations.)
> 
> After you've done that, it should immediately flush your dns. Open League, log in, and check to make sure that functionality is restored to your Play button once more.
> 
> Lemme know if this helped, my dudes.

Copy-pasting this from the post I just made. Let me know if it works out.

It sort of worked.. because now it's patching again xD
we will see after that.
update: didn't help. I can put my username and password but still doesn't connect to the server
> Unable to connect to the login queue.  check the server status

The fact that you were in the middle of a patch and you weren't able to connect to the server (if the issue was indeed the DNS) then it's very possible some of your data may have been corrupted. Try repairing your client if this is still an issue.
I've tried to repair the client, but is says it fails when it completes
I see. Have you tried logging in on both the legacy and the current client?
If you are on mac go to Ã„pple icon on top left,then system preferences, then go to connections, then advanced and clear the dns. That should work

~~The rads error you're seeing, likely on the legacy client, can occur when some OS setting is blocking your game files from being accessed.  I know you mention your permissions being set already, but I suggest going over each step of the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide just to make sure that everything is configured to allow league as an exception.~~

As far as the gray play button goes, this can happen with an unstable connection failing to reach the patching servers or essentially losing pulse with pvp.net.  if this continues, try the steps in the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide to make sure that your network doesn't run into any hiccups on the updated client.  

I see some posts were able to help, and these additional troubleshooting methods might as well!


-- As a correction, this is likely a [connection issue](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues).  If you are getting a gray Play button on the updated client, the legacy client may mirror that as a RADS error (which is often a permissions or connection issue).

hey guys had the same issue but I got on, I noticed that sometimes the client will fluctuate and give me the error message and be fine, so I tried to log in while it was working properly but it went back into error too fast, so the next thing I tried was opening my internet explorer browser cause I remember riot using that browser for their servers or something like that. after it was open and loaded for 5 seconds the client started working properly. hope this helps.
